text: Zoë Kravitz (born December 1, 1988) is an American actress, singer and model. She is the daughter of musician Lenny Kravitz and Lisa Bonet. She is of African-American, Afro-Bahamian and Ashkenazi Jewish (from Belarus, Moldova, Poland, Russia and Ukraine) descent. Kravitz first acted in the 2007 movie No Reservations. She is known for her role as Catwoman in the 2022 movie The Batman. ==Career== Kravitz' first big role was as Angel Salvadore in the 2011 superhero movie X-Men: First Class. She later had supporting roles in movies, like The Lego Batman Movie and the Harry Potter spin-off movie Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them. She also acted in independent movies, like Dope in 2015 and HBO's drama Big Little Lies. Kravitz was the face of Vera Wang's Princess fragrance in 2009. She later modeled for Elle magazine. Kravitz is with the group Lolawolf. Lolawolf is an American contemporary R&B; and electropop duo. They released their first album, Calm Down, in 2014. The band toured with Miley Cyrus, Lily Allen and others. In October 2019, she was cast as Catwoman in the 2022 crime-thriller movie The Batman. Kravitz was born in Los Angeles, California. ==Awards== Year Association Category Nominated work Result 2011 Black Reel Awards Best Breakthrough Performance It's Kind of a Funny Story 2011 Scream Awards Breakout Performance-Female X-Men: First Class 2011 Teen Choice Awards Choice Movie Chemistry X-Men: First Class 2011 Teen Choice Awards Choice Movie Breakout: Female X-Men: First Class 2019 Grammy Awards Album of the Year "Dirty Computer" (as featured artist of Janelle Monae) Kravitz was ranked one of the best dressed women in 2018 by fashion website Net-a-Porter. ==References== Category:American television actors Category:American movie actors Category:Singers from California Category:Models from Los Angeles Category:Actors from Los Angeles Category:African-American actors Category:Jewish American actors Category:1988 births Category:Living people
title: Zoë Kravitz
